newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian rail workers to strike next week.
newsitem.headline: Belgian rail workers to strike next week.

text.p: Two Belgian railway workers' unions said on Friday they would hold a 24-hour strike in some districts beginning on Monday.

Christian and socialist unions say they are going on strike because they are unhappy about the management's information policy and fears that a restructuring and investment plan for the NMBS/SNCB national railway will result in job losses.
Under the plan, to be completed by 2005, SNCB is to be split up into autonomous units.

Johnny Van Den Rijse, general secretary of the railways section of the socialist FGTB, told Belgian radio that management had suddenly presented new elements to the plan at a meeting on Thursday night.
"After six months of talks, we heard things for the first time yesterday," he said.
The FGTB section has some 25,000 members employed by the SNCB.
The strike, which will begin at 2000 GMT on Monday, will affect rail traffic in the provinces of Antwerp, Limburg and Henegouwen. A 24-hour strike on April 24 will hit the Brussels area.
